result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher E. WATKINS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Execution of sentence is stayed and the defendant is placed on probation to DOC.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety and no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs.

Have no contact with William Dorman or his family without the agent's approval.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.

Cover letter.
Motion to Withdraw Post Conviction Motion.
Defendant's Notice and Motion for Postconviction Relief.

It is ordered that the no-merit report is rejected and Attorney Jeffrey Mann's motion to be relieved of further representation of the defendant is denied.
It is further ordered that the no-merit appeal is dismissed without prejudice.
It is further ordered that the time for filing a postconviction motion is extended to 05-16-18.
It is further ordered that this summary disposition order will not be published.
Motion to Dismiss No Merit Report and for Enlargement of Time to File Motion for Postconviction Relief.
Motion for Enlargement of Time to File Supplemental No-Merit Robert or Notice of Appeal

It is ordered that on or before March 5, 2018, appointed appellate counsel shall file either a motion to correct the record or the supplemental no-merit report and affidavit, if appropriate, required by this order.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher E. WATKINS
Current: 911 State Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 05-13-2015)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220
RE:  William Dorman, on 05-10-15.

At 3:00 p.m., $5,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of fail to submit to biological specimen, false imprisonment, substantial battery and 2nd degree reckless injury.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-18-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information and submit to a DNA sample within 24 hours of release. have no contact with William Dorman and Cortez Watkins and do not possess any weapons.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
